.
Discontinuing an Award Due to Marriage
Follow the instructions in the table below upon receipt of notice of the marriage of a child deemed permanently incapable of self-support.
Note
:  It is not necessary to refer the case to the rating activity.
If ...
Then ...
VA is paying benefits
to
the child
discontinue the child’s award effective the first day of the month in which the marriage occurred.
the child is a dependent on a beneficiary’s award
remove the child from the award effective the first day of the month following the month in which the marriage occurred.
Important
:  If the beneficiary is receiving pension, and removal of the child will result in an
increase
in benefits, follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, 1.F.3.i
.
References
:  For more information on
when to restore an award if a marriage is dissolved, see
M21-1, Part X
, Subpart ii, 6.B.4.c
when to apply due process, see
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 1.B
reducing or discontinuing benefits due to the marriage of a child, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 3.C.1
an adjustment under
38 CFR 3.500(n)(2)
of a surviving spouse’s or consolidated award in cases of marriage of a child, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 3.C.1.e
, and
discontinuing or adjusting an award to or for a child incapable of self-support for reasons other than the child’s marriage, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 6.B.5.c
.
